item.title: Aladdin Street strives to become one of the top 10 e-marketplaces worldwide
item.description:
Source: Aladdin Group. A lion dance to welcome Aladdin Street Singapore. The Aladdin Group is launching Aladdin Street Singapore, an e-commerce platform serving both businesses and individual consumers. It will operate through two websites: a Singapore-specific site at www.aladdinstreet.com.sg, and an international platform at www.aladdinstreet.com. Both sites are expected to launch in the fourth quarter of 2016. Aladdinstreet’s goal is to be a reliable and secure online marketplace for merchants to sell and consumers to buy premium, halal products...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/aladdin-street-strives-to-become-one-of-the-top-10-e-marketplaces-worldwide/

item.title: Consumers are now blending their physical and digital experiences. How should companies respond?
item.description:
A new study emphasizes the importance of personalization in merging online and offline shopping experiences for “phy-gital” consumers. The study found that while companies are embracing digital technologies, they are lagging in implementing personalization strategies that consumers desire. The study revealed that personalized promotions significantly influence purchasing decisions, encouraging consumers to buy familiar products and explore new ones. However, there’s a disconnect between consumer expectations and company investments. While consumers value enhanced search and comparison features, companies prioritize features like shopping lists and social elements...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/consumers-are-now-blending-their-physical-and-digital-experiences-how-should-companies-respond/

item.title: The Pi1M Training Programme offered by Digi provides benefits to small business owners
item.description:
Source: Digi. Participants of the Pi1M Training Programme gathered for a group photo. Digi Telecommunications recently conducted a training program for community members residing near the company-managed Pusat Internet 1 Malaysia (Pi1M) centers. This tailored program reflects Digi’s commitment to fostering online entrepreneurship within its Pi1M communities. Currently, Digi manages 34 Pi1Ms across Pahang, Kelantan, Terengganu, Johor, Melaka, and Sarawak, with plans to establish 70 more centers by year’s end...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-pi1m-training-programme-offered-by-digi-provides-benefits-to-small-business-owners/

item.title: Shopee Malaysia and Pos Malaysia are working together for order fulfillment
item.description:
Shopee Malaysia has partnered with Pos Malaysia, the national courier service, to offer free shipping to all sellers on its platform. Shopee, a mobile-first social marketplace with a strong regional presence of over 12 million users, operates as a free online customer-to-customer (C2C) platform. Launched in December 2015, Shopee aims to empower both individual and business entrepreneurs to conduct secure buying and selling transactions on their mobile devices. In Malaysia alone, Shopee’s app has been downloaded over a million times within a six-month timeframe...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/shopee-malaysia-and-pos-malaysia-are-working-together-for-order-fulfillment/
